website_summaries.verdict: In spite of some concerns, it's a good deal. If you need a budget-friendly kneeling chair, it's worth a look.
pros: Memory foam padding and a sturdy black metal frame
cons: Individual components such as the seat and knee pad don't  adjust separately
Tilt and height must be adjusted together, which doesn't work for some users

customer_reviews.title: recycled destroyed item
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived taped up like it had been around the world. inside, each part of the chair had been ripped out of plastic, and no parts/ screws were included in the box. Seems like someone should have taken the time to look inside the box that another customer returned, before reshipping it to me.
customer_reviews.author: east side photo

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to assemble - A+
customer_reviews.text: Love the chair, comfortable, back is straight up which feels great. Thank you for also making the assembly probably the easiest and quickest I have ever experienced. It took me 10 minutes. Would recommend. If you keep the chair flatter it is better for your back than raising it at a higher angle. So glad I found the perfect angle for me, good bye chair with arms that was so bad for me ergonomically, hello knee chair!
customer_reviews.author: Hld

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: I did not recieve assembly instructions but it was still relatively easy to assemble. I like that it has fabric cushions, they do not get too hot sitting on all day. I do wish the cushions were of better quality, they do get a bit flat feeling by the end of the day. The chair does promote good posture. I would also like the seat of the chair to sit lower, I am short and the seat sits almost too high above the knee pads. Overall a well made product
customer_reviews.author: smlva

customer_reviews.title: Just go with a simple office chair
customer_reviews.text: If you use this everyday, probably need to get a cushion. I'm 4'10 and it fits me well on the lowest setting. I'm having to get up every hour to stretch my back because it hurts. My posture has not improved sitting in the chair. Probably should have just gone with a regular office chair.
customer_reviews.author: Short Fuse

customer_reviews.title: If you don't like to put toys together.....don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: This product had the worst diagrams and instructions. They might as well have written them in chinese, because I wouldn't have understood them. I couldn't understand one thing about it, there was no youtube to learn how to put it together, so I sent it back. No I would not recommend this item to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: timbo

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad. Mechanically, it works as intended. However, it isn't very comfortable. The padding is only soft for the first couple of minutes, and then it flattens out and it feels like you are sitting on hard wood. If you need a cheap kneeling chair just to find out if you like the design, then go ahead and buy this one for testing. If you KNOW you want a kneeling chair and are looking for the right one, then look elsewhere. I recommend paying more for a better chair if your health is your concern.
customer_reviews.author: KALTM

customer_reviews.title: Defective manufacturing process.
customer_reviews.text: Unable to assemble. Holes drilled prior to item being welded. Does not align.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Derby

customer_reviews.title: Foam Compresses Quickly!
customer_reviews.text: This chair barely lasted a few months before the foam compressed to nothing and it was like sitting on a hard board. It's a real shame because the rest of the chair is great - height adjustment, angle etc...But what an awful thing to sit on once the foam compresses. They should just use better foam because this would easily be a 5 star chair at that point. But to last about 3 months is an insane waste of money. I am back shopping for a better option.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Eisenberg

customer_reviews.title: which was still more comfortable than this one
customer_reviews.text: The memory foam padding is so inferior that I decided to keep my old worn out knee chair, which was still more comfortable than this one. Returning it was not a pleasant experience. The third-party company closed the ticket before I was even able to get a tracking number, but did re-open after I pointed out it had been a weekend and I wasn't able to send it back. They charged a 30% re-stocking fee and since I also had to pay for the shipping, it was an expensive undertaking. Be very sure you'll keep it if you decide to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ursula Schwarz

customer_reviews.title: Bought the chair in May. By September it was ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the chair in May. By September it was apparent the threading on the screw holes did not work well. The chair continually loosens up, and I have had to re-tighten continually. In doing so, one screw no longer threads. It seems the problem begins with an inaccurate line-up of pads, and seat to frame. I am well within the suggested weight requirement. The chair is still somehow somewhat useable, and still within a somewhat fair comfort zone. I am just very careful to maintain a degree of tightness of the knee pads, and seat as much as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Broke within two months
customer_reviews.text: It was a fine chair until one of the knee pad brackets broke under normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S. Barrera III

customer_reviews.title: The pads are junk !
customer_reviews.text: I use the chair daily for work, the foam lasted a week before failing... I have upgraded the foam and I am again happy. The frame is solid and failrly light weight. It's rated for 200lb max, I myself am 215 and zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: SCRYER

customer_reviews.title: cushions are v poor quality
customer_reviews.text: So I just received this today and put it together immediately because I always enjoyed this type of chair and lost my previous chair due to water damage. My butt and knees are so sore after a little more than one hour because as I sit down my butt hits the hard plywood bottom almost instantly. I only weigh 160 pounds too! My knees also completely compress the knee pads so I am kneeling on wood again. I am happy to pay more, I can only imagine how uncomfortable this chair will be once the cushions break down!!! I will try and return this chair.
customer_reviews.author: jeffreygeorge

customer_reviews.title: Too tall
customer_reviews.text: Just put it together and am sitting at my desk for the first time. I will do a follow up as far as comfort and back issues are concerned later on. Initially I am saddened to say, with the castor wheels on, this thing is way to high above the level of my office desk.It results in having to look down at the monitors and make major adjustments to my ergo armrests. I have had to take the castor wheels off which is a pain, in order to get down to a better, more practice working height.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna

customer_reviews.title: Not for 8 hours a day but great to alternate with my office chair
customer_reviews.text: I've had similar chairs off and on since the 90's and this is comparable to any of them. Don't plan on using this as your only chair if you work at a desk 8 hours a day. But it is a great relief to your back and all of your posture, aches and pains from sitting all day at a computer office chair set up. If this is your only chair, yeah, you probably would wear out or compress it flat in a short time
customer_reviews.author: O Mills

customer_reviews.title: The chair is fine. Assembled easily
customer_reviews.text: The chair is fine. Assembled easily, seems reasonably well made. However, I cannot use it. The knee pads are too thin, and within minutes, my shins are in excruciating pain. The chair is utterly unusable. I'm 5'11, 210. Searching for solutions, alternatives. Would appreciate any suggestions as to cushions, other similar chairs that don't cause agony within 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorOfLove

customer_reviews.title: Works great with some padding augumentation for longer sitting periods
customer_reviews.text: I have PFD and I bought this to help take pressure off my pelvic area. This is a good chair with some modifications. It is VERY comfortable for short periods...but as others have mentioned, for longer periods the padding doesn't quite do the job. (My BMI is a nice 27% for the record...weight is not the issue). So...I bought two Purple cushions--yes, the same company that makes the mattresses--and now I can sit on it for longer periods. This definitely added to the expense but it really helped. I put the square purple on the seat and foldable kind for the knees.
customer_reviews.author: ScarlettFeverr

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I notice it makes my feet swell up. Also, as others have noted, the knee pads become useless very quickly. There is a label on the seat that says "Max 200 lbs."
customer_reviews.author: R. GAZY

customer_reviews.title: Between okay and I like it
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together, since I didn't have to ask my neighbor for help. The only thing I don't like is that the foam rubber cushions are rather cheap. They are too soggy if that makes sense. It was worth the money, but I would not have paid more. The chair serves its purpose and does make my back feel better.
customer_reviews.author: ManyHummingbirds

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice chair - replaced my old one, and now I wish I hadn't waited so long. I paint sitting at an art table, so this type of chair is vital to my livelihood - and this one lived up to all expectations, and then some. VERY glad that I bought this (or rather, that my roommate bought it for me for Christmas, after I told her what I wanted) - it is literally one of the best and most useful gifts I've ever received.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rockwell

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and instant relief from sitting pain.
customer_reviews.text: Works great....have used it at my desk job for the last 4 months! I bought it because of a back injury and got immediate relief from sitting pain. Great value for the price. I would definitely buy it again and I recommend it to anyone who wants to try this type of chair for a relatively low cost. I am short (5'5') and weight about 170# and it fits me very well.
customer_reviews.author: Boggyman

customer_reviews.title: "I don't understand the point..."
customer_reviews.text: no idea why this is more ergonomic, don't feel the difference, back still bends as there's no back support, constantly feel like I'm slipping out, just not comfortable especially with the wheels sliding all the time. I also feel like I'm sweating the knee pads out in the summer which means constant wash and dry. I might go back to just a good old fashion wooden chair.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Defect Prevents Assembly
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately a defect in one of the holes for attaching a knee pad prevents its assembly. The manufacturer provides a toll-free number to call for help, but it works only in that you can use it to learn how to write them an e-mail. It took two days to hear back from the company after I sent an e-mail. The response wasn't helpful--a statement that I need to prove the chair is still under warranty to get a replacement part. I'm returning the item to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Love this chair
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this chair so much at work that several co-workers have also bought the chair. They love the chair as well. The design keeps my spine much straighter, so no more slouching and having a tight back later. I have some knee issues so I was concerned that the chair may aggravate that, but it doesn't. I have little to no pressure on my knees. It does take a week or two to get used to the new way of sitting, I recommend alternating between this and a regular chair for the first week or so if you are unsure about how you like it.
customer_reviews.author: MD13

customer_reviews.title: Knees not as adjustable, Seat needs center "cutout", pressure shifts to knee & shins on tall people.
customer_reviews.text: Plus: sturdy frame, stable rollers, soft cushion, nice seat adjustment, fits nicely under any desk. Seems good if you're 5 feet tall (kids love it). Minus: I'm 6' tall. I wish I could drop the knees as well as raising the seat. Raising seat puts me "too high" above my desk and the knee pads shift to the top of my shins. I believe that if I could adjust the angle and position of the kneepads it would help. Minus: the Seat needs a center cutout (or two separate seat pads) to distribute pressure to my legs, because too much pressure is falling "in the middle (as if I was spending all day on a narrow bike seat)
customer_reviews.author: K. Cuddeback

customer_reviews.title: Sciatica is getting better
customer_reviews.text: I love my new chair. I have a bulging disc in my low back that causes me sciatic pain. It is hard for me to sit in traditional chairs for long without pain. I am a graduate student, though--I have a lot of desk work everyday! I don't have back pain when I use this chair. It takes some getting used to. Sitting in these kneeling chairs uses a lot more back/shoulder muscles than other chairs. It can be a bit exhausting at first, but building these muscles is good for people with bad backs like me! I also like that the chair fits completely under my desk, so it doesn't take up any extra space.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Green

customer_reviews.title: The only chair I use at my office desk
customer_reviews.text: After four years, this chair is still as good as new. The chair has helped with my posture and I have no lower back pain. I prefer it adjusted high, which throws more pressure on the shin bones, but I got used to that after a few months. A bit more padding for the knees would be welcome. All in all, a very good, solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Mayfly

customer_reviews.title: Great value and lower back relief equals you should consider buying this
customer_reviews.text: This chair is great for the money. Will it survive 5 years of daily office use, probably not but I had a kneeling chair costing 4 times what this one costs and it didn't last that long. It's comfortable and I can adjust it for my height (6'). I think the cushions will be the first to go but whatta ya gonna do? It's light weight yet sturdy and the casters slide smoothly on my carpeted floor. And it completely slides under my desk for storage. If it wears out I'll just buy another.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Padding is thin
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together, and not too heavy to carry. At 5'2', it fits me fine. I definitely feel much more comfortable than on a traditional chair. However, after long term use, the padding is just horribly inadequate. Now, I have to choose between either a normal chair that makes my back and hips hurt, or this one, which makes but buttocks ache. I'm trying to figure out how to re-upholster the chair pad, if I can.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair. Unfortunately I wasn't thinking when I purchased it as I need to use a foot pedal for my job and it's kind of hard to do that when your feet are up in the air behind you. Ha. But I just switched chairs from my "play" computer to my work computer and it's all good. Can't stay in it for long periods of time without fidgeting and repositioning though.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for lower back pain
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair so much. It has done wonders for my lower back pain/sciatica. I had planned to alternate between this and my ergonomic chair, but hands-down, this kneeling chair is soooo much better. The price was great, it was easy to put together, and it's incredibly comfortable. I highly recommend this chair!
customer_reviews.author: Pittsburgh Wife

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Assemble and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The product was very easy to assemble taking less than 30 minutes. The casters roll very smoothly and it is comfortable to use. The only bad thing is that the packaging department should ease up on the tape.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I battled with the idea of a "stand up desk", or some other way of not having back pain. This forces me to sit up, and is comfortable, and easy to get in and out of.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Not for short people
customer_reviews.text: While this was a comfortable chair initially, it proved unsuitable for steady use. If you're short (I'm 5'), its adjustments really don't do anything to adapt to the user's height, so I ended on the edge of the seat, which rapidly became unbearable. The padding isn't dense enough to keep the edge of the seat from biting. I tried every variation, and nothing short of effectively flat (which defeats the purpose) was comfortable enough to use this as a regular office chair.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wendel

customer_reviews.title: Knee discomfort
customer_reviews.text: I like the way the positions adjust and I can successfully relieve pressure from my lower back. The trade off is I do experience a bit of discomfort on my left knee/shin in particular. I have to get off frequently to regain more circulation in my legs and alleviate the discomfort. The padding does feel hard after a while. I've tried all positions and still experience the knee/shin discomfort.I weigh 164 pounds, probably 15% at most body fat, 5'4", and am 63 years old male.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel 13

customer_reviews.title: This chair makes it effortless to work for hours
customer_reviews.text: I knew it would help with my back (bulging disc at L4-L5), it is so comfortable and helps strengthen my lower back, I am convinced. No stress on any part of the body with this chair! I work at a desk for long hours daily, it does not feel like I have been sitting for hours with this chair. I bought one for my nephew who is in high school. He loves it, too! I absolutely recommend this chair for anyone who spends any time at a desk/computer. The memory foam is a great bonus.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hamm

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for lashing!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a lash artist and this has been a blessing during my busy days. It fits nicely under my massage table I use for my clients. Super cush seat and it lines up nicely for my legs.
customer_reviews.author: Angee K

customer_reviews.title: Great for Office Workers
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try this chair out to see if it would help improve my posture and relieve some of the pain of sitting at a desk all day. I did immediately feel it benefited my posture. It prevents slouching and encourages engaging your core and straightening out your spine. At the end of the day I don't feel the pain in my low back and hamstrings I used to have. The only downside is it shifts some weight onto your shins which can get bothersome after a while. But that is a worthwhile tradeoff to me, and I can always switch back to a regular office chair for a little while if my shins need a break.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan B

customer_reviews.title: Sooooooo much more comfortable than a "normal" chair
customer_reviews.text: Great way to try out a kneeling chair. I am now absolutely sold on this concept. I am 6'3" and and probably around 220 lbs. I am a little too long for this chair, but with a little rolled up towel here and a little adjusting there, this chair functions great. I could not reasonably ask for more, considering what other kneeling chairs cost. Go for this one - you will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs this.
customer_reviews.text: If you sit alot, YOU HAVE TO HAVE THIS THING. I've not had a single problem with it. My back doesn't hurt and it's second nature to sit in it. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie M.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after my back was really starting to hurt and I found the yoga ball too distracting to sit on. I will say, after research they say it's not good to ALWAYS sit on this, but it's good to switch back and forth to keep your back comfy. I was also worried it would be akward to sit in, and it's not at all. IN fact several people in my office ordered it after they tried mine out!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Britt

customer_reviews.title: A Great Value for Relief
customer_reviews.text: In August 2012, I suffered from a painful bout of sciatica. Thankfully with some good physical therapy, I was back to normal in a couple of months. During that time I bought 2 nearly identical kneeling chairs: one for work and one for home. I still use both a year later. This one from Amazon (used at home) was roughly half the price for virtually the same chair that I purchased at a local back store franchise (used at the office) -- keep in mind that I was desperate for relief when I purchased the one for the office. Amazon's offering is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: smbkrn

customer_reviews.title: BUYERS BEWARE -- MAXIMUM CHAIR WEIGHT IS 200lbs.  NOT AS ADVERTISED!
customer_reviews.text: Returned. After unpacking, reading the instructions and warranty, and then assembling the product, I noticed a sticker on the seat saying maximum chair weight is 200lbs. The Amazon ad specifies 250lbs and the warranty in the box says 250lbs. Concerned, I called Office Star and was told by an agent that the maximum limit was 200lbs. Very annoyed. Wasted everyone's time!
customer_reviews.author: LynnG

customer_reviews.title: Ouch My Shins!
customer_reviews.text: My shins were very sore after using this chair at work. I sit at a computer on and off for about 6 hours at work. My back felt good but the padding wasn't sturdy enough to support my shins. I had a red mark on one leg.
customer_reviews.author: Tortuga

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: This is my first kneeling chair and I use it for short bursts of time. The padding is very comfortable esp on the knees. I had to air out the chair for a few days before using it. The memory foam smelled bad but all is well now. Would be great if the seat and knee pads adjusted separately but doesn't bother me much. I generally move my knees into different positions to feel comfortable for extended use. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: pic perfect

customer_reviews.title: it just collapses and you feel like you're sitting/kneeling on the flat boards underneath the foam
customer_reviews.text: The foam on this seat is not dense enough. It doesn't cushion you, it just collapses and you feel like you're sitting/kneeling on the flat boards underneath the foam. The only reason it's not a one star is because the chair seems pretty sturdy. Other than that, it's junk. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Just not for me...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the memory foam seat!!! Much more comfortable than others I tried out quickly in stores. However, overall this chair has made some things more challenging to do & my knees get sore so I often end up sitting with my feet on the floor & attempt to keep my back as neutral as possible. I think it's all personal preference & this might work wonderfully for other people! The 3 stars only demonstrate my personal experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair for Classroom Use
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this chair, and so do my students! I use it when working at my desk and when working side-by-side with my art students. It promotes good, comfortable posture. I sometimes give my students the privilege of using my "special chair" for the day, and they say it's the best chair they've ever used.

customer_reviews.title: This chair puts me in a very comfortable posture. I sit at a desk and type ...
customer_reviews.text: This chair puts me in a very comfortable posture. I sit at a desk and type and the years of overuse resulted in shoulder pain. This chair provided relief, at first. Then the cushion started to wear, the wheels stopped gliding, and now I have to fight the chair to get it to roll. The wheels drag. It was very comfortable for the first month, but is now just a piece of junk taking up space until I bring myself to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Takes some getting used too but it's nice to switch up your seating position every once in a while. It does hurt my knees if I sit in it for too long but my back does feel better at the end of the day if I spend a few hours in it over my normal chair. Quality seems to be decent enough. I've only retightened screws once since I got it and I've had to readjust my seating position a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: fierce

customer_reviews.title: Comfort, comfort, comfort
customer_reviews.text: I had already purchased one of these for my office. The second for a small desk area in my kitchen. The chair includes easy to follow assembly directions and takes little time/effort to assemble. The chair is durable, made of quality materials and is very comfortable. I had owned one of these chairs many years ago and forgot just how comfortable they are. I can sit for longer periods of time without my back getting stiff/sore.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Newman, Seattle

customer_reviews.title: I love the idea.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these years ago. I was hoping that the memory foam would make a tremendous difference in comfort. Unfortunately, I still find it a bit uncomfortable. To be fair, I'm also probably a bit outside the normal user's specs. I'm 6' 1" and 300 pounds. If I was 200 pounds, it might be more comfortable. It's a nice change from a regular chair for a few minutes, but I can't say that it's a long-term replacement. Have a great day.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A.

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not so good.
customer_reviews.text: For the first 10 minutes, I loved the chair, but noticed my knees (shins) got sore within 30 minutes. Butt got sore next. The positive is that my back felt better :). My issue is hip flexors, so my new plan is swapping back and forth between this chair and a Swiss Ball and standing with a pub height table . . . this will be a good way to remember to get up and move every 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: deet

customer_reviews.title: Poorly machined/manufactured
customer_reviews.text: Overall an ok kneeling chair if you can manage to get it together. Assembly wasn't hard except for the large pin holes which were not aligned well by the time the parts were manufactured. I had to hone out the hole a bit to make the pin fit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chair was pretty simple to put together
customer_reviews.text: Chair was pretty simple to put together, cushions are of pretty good quality, definitely helps you engage your lower back while sitting. One the to keep in mind is this chair's capacity is 201lbs on the chair, and it does appear to be somewhat chintzy but I'm sure it will be fine if it isn't roughed up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not quite there...
customer_reviews.text: It is very good for my back, but my knees pay the price. I do not suppose there is any good posture for many hours. I use it to work and that, unfortunately is 9 strait hours sitting in front of a computer. My knees get sore. I try to move as much as work allows, but that is not enough. There is an improvement, but it is not magic. The quality of the chair is good and the cushions are very soft. No complaints on these aspects.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Redin

customer_reviews.title: Knee Pads Not Thick Enough
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived needing to be assembled. The site didn't mention this, but I wasn't surprised given the size of the chair. The written instructions were a little confusing, but the diagram helped a lot. It took me about a half hour to assmble, and I'm not mechanically inclined. It is a nice looking chair with a comfortable seat. I wish the knee pads were thicker and more dense. My knees began to ache after a half hour due to the metal around the pads. I don't think I'd recommend this model for adults.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. White

customer_reviews.title: It is OK, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It is OK, especially for the price. I'm supposed to use it a few hours / day at work, but I do get hip cramps if I use it too long. It is adjustable, I have it at close to the max height / tilt setting, but this is where my PT said to put it.
customer_reviews.author: Lake Life 2018

customer_reviews.title: Not Overly Exciting
customer_reviews.text: Chair arrived and it was relatively easy to set up. Although the chair is advertised as black, the cushions are red/burgundy. Not expecting that. Cushions are too soft and do not provide adequate support, you sink right to the wood bases of the seat and knee pads. Casters are good and chair moves around with you (when you want it to). Frame seems sturdy. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Richmond

customer_reviews.title: This chair helps posture.
customer_reviews.text: Useful for office, not hard on the knees like other ergonomically designed chairs that don't have rollers. The action of rolling a little breaks up the pressure on the knees. Plan on using it alternately with other chairs.
customer_reviews.author: F. Henley

customer_reviews.title: I found out in my old age I need all ...
customer_reviews.text: I found out in my old age I need all sorts of different types of seating. I missed my old knee stool. It's helping my spine. I'm short and learning to straddle it to sit down is exercise too. It hurt my legs leaning on the material but it's only natural with new things. Now my legs have toughened up. Didn't take long.
customer_reviews.author: Ethel Jean Saltz

customer_reviews.title: Great product so far
customer_reviews.text: I really like this! It's the first time since college that I used a kneeling chair (my roommate had one), and I feel as if my back is being massaged when I use it. I got it in order to alleviate lower-back problems, so that's great. It is well-padded--so I, for one, don't find it bothering my knees.
customer_reviews.author: CatA.

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: I barely use the chair. It starts off comfortable then my legs start to feel restless. I feel the need to stretch out. I am 5’8”. I may need a taller chair. I’m not sure.
customer_reviews.author: andreac

customer_reviews.title: My back loves it!
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are so good for my posture, but I can't find them in stores anymore. I was so glad that Amazon had this one. I couldn't believe how inexpensive it was for such a solid chair. The cushions are very comfortable. I thought my young son would enjoy the experience of building something with his own hands and he had no trouble with the easy assembly. Great job, Office Star!
customer_reviews.author: Rodney S StJohn

customer_reviews.title: Still use this every day...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, and always reminds me to sit up straight. Also helps relieve joint stress.
customer_reviews.author: James Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, well built chair.
customer_reviews.text: I had been having problems with my lower back and heard that this type of chair could make desk work more comfortable. I've had this chair for several months now, and I'm glad I got it. It's not a miracle, but it does make long sessions at the computer much more tolerable. The chair is well constructed and padded. I'm 6' 5" and 195 pounds with long legs, and I had no trouble adjusting the chair to my liking.
customer_reviews.author: Barbancourt

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable, the pads are very firm when in use
customer_reviews.text: Not very comfortable, the pads are very firm when in use. It does keep you with good upright posture, but it needs to be much less firm. Easy to assemble. Smooth rolling. But just not very easy to sit on for hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Game Master

customer_reviews.title: Have used these since college a billion years ago
customer_reviews.text: Just great for the body. I spend a lot of time at a desk.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: ... at work over the last month and am very pleased. While it doesn't solve all my physical ailments ...
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this chair at work over the last month and am very pleased. While it doesn't solve all my physical ailments it does provide relief from the discomfort of a regular office chair by taking pressure off the back of my thighs. I vary my position throughout the day - sometimes kneeling and sometimes I use it like a stool with my feet on the ground. My knees do get tired after awhile. No problems with the design or function so far. Rolls smoothly on the chair mat.
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: Good kneeling chair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few months ago to help alleviate lower back pain. This chair definitely helped. It was relatively easy to assemble and I haven't had any problems with it. I am 6'2" and I find most of the positions that I adjust it into are comfortable. It is never an uncomfortable chair but if it had a little foot rest at the back and slightly more padding on the seat it would be perfect. I highly recommend this chair based on my experience with it and the low price.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: For its price the chair is perfect. Very comfy. The only thing I changed were the casters, the ones provided are hard and would make marks on hardwood floors. Replacement caster can be bought on amazon as "Slipstick CB680 Rubber Caster Wheels, Set of 5" I did decide for this metal one instead of a wood version as the wood version do sometimes break. It is normal as wood is a naturally variable product and sometimes there are knots in the stress points.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Van der Hoeven

customer_reviews.title: It's comfortable for a smaller person but my husband is 200lbs ...
customer_reviews.text: It's comfortable for a smaller person but my husband is 200lbs and it really hurts his shins. The bolts fall out all the time and I have to keep tightening it which is really frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Thad reeder

customer_reviews.title: Feels much better than a typical desk chair
customer_reviews.text: Feels much better than a typical desk chair, although its not super great to look at, but that hardy bothers me personally, Wheels work well for me on my office carpet, and it was easy to assemble and bring into the office.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Lira

customer_reviews.title: Great items.
customer_reviews.text: Great items. Just as described. Fast Shipping and it arrived fast. Great Seller. Will buy more again soon. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: F. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: My First Ergo Knee Chair
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'2", 236#, with a subluxated lumbar disc. This chair has worked well at my 30" desktop on the lowest setting. If used properly (sitting up straight with only slight weight on the knee pads) this chair has been comfortable. For the price paid, it is functional and a good value. I agree the padding could be better but I did not want to try a more expensive chair unless I knew an ergo knee chair would work for me and I have been satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Z

customer_reviews.title: The concept is great. The only problem is the memory foam is ...
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great. The only problem is the memory foam is not nearly dense enough. It crushes down immediately to the point where it's like there's no cushion at all. Now I will be looking for some dense memory foam to try to make this chair work.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin R. Keck

customer_reviews.title: It made it worse. Probaby depends on your particular back issue
customer_reviews.text: I got this to help back pain I get while working at my desk. It made it worse. Probaby depends on your particular back issue. Mine is scoliosis and I tend to slouch after a few hours. I can't sit in this for even an hour before pain starts.
customer_reviews.author: cgoods

customer_reviews.title: a little hard on the knees
customer_reviews.text: The knee pads are too thin... I'll likely have to replace them with a firmer or thicker pads soon!
customer_reviews.author: Alan C. Earing

customer_reviews.title: This chairs helps my pain in my hips
customer_reviews.text: Better than any other chair I have found so far for my hips when I sit. I use to be in pain when I would sit in other chairs at the computer. You will have to remember to sit up straight though and hold your stomach in for the best effect. Nice it rolls around too. Probably would not work well for a heavy person though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty soft, but has "California cancer warning" I will ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty soft, but has "California cancer warning" I will only use it once in a while or for a guest, to limit exposure.
customer_reviews.author: Mike F

customer_reviews.title: Best chair ever!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other knee chairs and didn't really like them, but this one is like it was built for me personally. I'm 5'4" tall, 125 lbs. I sit on this chair for literally hours every day at work and I am never uncomfortable. In fact, I just bought a second one to use in my home office.
customer_reviews.author: Nudelmanz

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. The material is soft and feels comfortable
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The material is soft and feels comfortable. I haven't used it for extended periods of time yet, but I do suspect that the materials for the seat and knee pads could wear out soon. Definitely worth for use at home.
customer_reviews.author: E. Danao

customer_reviews.title: This char is ok
customer_reviews.text: This chair would be rated much higher if it would go down lower. I bought it to sit at my desk but it won't go down low enough for me to be comfortable. I am 6' and 200lbs. Due to it not going low enough, I mainly use it for a footstool because the memory foam is soft. It works well for one of my kids if they are sitting at the table.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Broughton

customer_reviews.title: It's working for me!
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers mentioned, the material is super flimsy so I already purchased a yard of replacement upholstery, which is more attractive anyway. Yes, the foam is softer than my old one, and the adjustment is meager, but this little chair is helping me avoid cervical spine pain.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline STop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Knee Chair
customer_reviews.text: This chair is exactly what I needed for work. The posture keeps my back in line and the way it "stores small" makes moving around my workspace much easer.
customer_reviews.author: Tim O'Bannon

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t sure when my husband bought this for me but I was surprised how comfortable it really is, and it’s not hard on your knees at all as I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Happy campers

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I should have checked the dimensions. The seat and knee pads are too big for my frame. This seat and knee pads are not comfortable. Sad. I will try to replace items for smaller seat and knee pad.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Simple comfortable kneeling chair that I can sit in all day long
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable chair that I've been using for years now. I can't sit in a regular office chair for more than 10 minutes so I've been using kneeling chairs for over ten years. This one was easy to put together and has held up very well. I'm amazed how well the memory foam has kept it's "foaminess." The only reason this is not a five-star review is that I keep checking to make sure a screw or end cap hasn't popped off the chair. For some reason they are apt to loosen themselves.
customer_reviews.author: S Abrams

customer_reviews.title: Other than that little misunderstandings the product is great and assembly was easy
customer_reviews.text: Works! Only problem was that the short screws were actually pre-attached to the pivot pins and I thought they were missing and had them ship spares which they did promptly. And they were so tight it took me some effort to get them off. Other than that little misunderstandings the product is great and assembly was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Srinivasan Venkataramani

customer_reviews.title: came broken
customer_reviews.text: The holes for the screw in the top part are misaligned so that the screw won't go in. Got a faulty product.
customer_reviews.author: Karishma Sonde

customer_reviews.title: This will do.
customer_reviews.text: Feels sturdy to me, but I weight under 100lbs. My knees get really sweaty on this. The cushions are comfortable even after an hour or so of using the chair. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Thanks
customer_reviews.text: Exactly, what i needed and great response & delivery. thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ugly But Helpful
customer_reviews.text: This chair really helps keep my back straight and helps with neck pain from sitting over a computer all day. My other chair is a Herman Miller Aeron. This is better for posture and pain for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: my massage therapist recommended the knee chair while using the computer
customer_reviews.text: After suffering for several years with neck, arm and shoulder pain, my massage therapist recommended the knee chair while using the computer. Within 2 weeks the pain subsided and I am more flexible in my neck and shoulders. I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MS Southern

customer_reviews.title: Good little office chair
customer_reviews.text: This chair is very effective at helping me hold better posture while working at my desk. The only downside is after a couple hours I have to take a break from sitting because my knees and shins start to hurt a bit. However, I would probably want to take a break from sitting after that amount of time anyway, regardless of the chair.
customer_reviews.author: C. McNab

customer_reviews.title: Good chair
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and does help. I got it because I have a sciatica. For this condition it helps. First week it was a bit troublesome since I had to engage the back muscles I usually did not use, but now, after those muscles got stronger everything is fine. For my height and weight (5 foot 9 and 150 pounds - 175 cm and 68 kg) chair is very comfortable and easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Villepique

customer_reviews.title: Works Well for Me
customer_reviews.text: I have used the chair for over a month--works great. After a few days, you should re-tighten the screws. By the way, I am not overweight and 5' 11" tall. Padding is adequate for me. Feels safe and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Danielson

customer_reviews.title: Its very comfortable and found there is enough padding on my knees ...
customer_reviews.text: Its very comfortable and found there is enough padding on my knees and on the seat. I am 5" 8" tall and 175lb. Much better on my back then a normal desk chair. This chair has made a good difference for my back.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: I love the chair
customer_reviews.text: I love the chair! It's comfortable and I have no issues with the amount of padding. Several of my coworkers have tried it out and are getting one for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa waters

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to tighten the bolts periodically
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this every day since I got it and it is very comfortable. The only problem I have with it (and it does say this clearly in the directions) is that I have to remember to tighten the bolts periodically as they seem to work free fairly often. But it does say to do this in the directions
customer_reviews.author: Kristine A. Ellor

product_meta.title: Office Star Ergonomically Designed Knee Chair with Casters, Memory Foam and Black Metal Base Black
product_meta.description: Ergonomically designed knee chair featuring memory foam and coral fabric with dual wheel carpet casters. Thick padded seat and knee pad. Manual Height adjustment. Black metal frame.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars480 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
